item.title: DSS Seminar 04: Mapping Data in R
item.description: Our Fall, 2017 seminar series will be a four-part introduction to working with spatial data in R. We’ll cover the basics of spatial data structures, merging data frames, and using ggplot2 to create maps. No experience with R, GIS work, or mapping is required! Please note that we ask that participants commit to all four seminar dates. Where: 3600 Morrissey Hall When: Wednesdays (Sept. 20, Oct. 4, Oct. 18, & Nov.

item.title: Protecting Your Data
item.description: On September 6th, we will be hosting a short one-hour seminar focused on some general strategies for protecting your research data against hard drive failure, structure fires, natural disasters, and other calamities. If you’ve ever worried about what would happen to your work if this happened at your home or in your office but aren’t sure how to back your data up effectively, this seminar is for you! We’ll introduce some basic strategies and have plenty of time for Q & A.

item.title: Seminars
item.description: Current Seminars (Fall, 2017) DSS Seminar 04: Mapping Data in R Protecting Your Data Seminar OpenGIS Past Seminars DSS Seminar 03: Building Linear Models in R (Spring, 2017) Session 03-1 - R and RStudio Session 03-2 - Descriptive Statistics Session 03-3 - Hypothesis Testing Session 03-4 - Correlation Session 03-5 - Linear Regression ATLAS Week 2017: Accessible Data Analysis DSS Seminar 02: Plots & Figures in R (Fall, 2016) Session 02-1 - R and RStudio Session 02-2 - Normality Plots Session 02-3 - ggplot2 Basics Session 02-4 - More ggplot2 Session 02-5 - Plot Layouts DSS Seminar 01: Data Management in R (Spring, 2016) Session 01-1 - R and RStudio Session 01-2 - Importing and Describing Data Session 01-3 - Recoding Numeric Variables Session 01-4 - Factor Variables Session 01-5 - More Factors Session 01-6 - String Variables

item.title: Home
item.description: We are a collaborative, interdisciplinary group at Saint Louis University focused on building researchers’ data science skills using open source software. We currently host seminars focused on the programming language R. The DSS is organized by Christina Garcia, Kelly Lovejoy, and Chris Prener.
